instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-00165-a
threads.message:
Liquid damaged on Bios chip. I did the cleanup and re-soldered the contacts all good but there's a strange issue. Once i power on the laptop i need to reset pram so it's gonna boot into OS,if i restart it will boot but if i do shutdown on boot after hands with full bar and apple logo. No other damage from liquid and also if i try to reinstall the os with internet recovery or usb and even with new ssd just hangs on apple logo with full bar.

Thanks

threads.title: 820-00165-a
threads.message:
Try to clean ME region on BIOS.
If doesn't help, then try FULL known good BIOS, clean ME too.

threads.title: 820-00165-a
threads.message: What i notice that when i power it on with pram reset and it works fine. Once i close the lid and leave it on stand by the laptop restarts and after there's a error for the sleep wake...

threads.title: 820-00165-a
threads.message: Hello ! i had same problem with a 820-00165-A, I cleaned ME Region and it worked fine.
